but language reveals 'bias', study says Research into judgements from 1950 to 2025 suggests India's top court often reinforces caste hierarchies in language, even while upholding Dalit rights. 3 days ago Asia More than 300 flights cancelled as Indigo faces 'staff shortage' Indigo said the disruptions were caused by technical glitches and the impact of updated crew roster rules. 6 hrs ago Asia India scraps order to pre-install state-run cyber safety app on smartphones The order to make the registration mandatory had led to a major backlash from several cyber experts. 1 day ago Asia South Africa chase record 359 to beat India South Africa complete the joint highest chase in the history of one-day internationals in India as they passed a target of 359 to win by four wickets in Naya Raipur. 19 hrs ago Cricket Features Why 2026 will be a year like no other for India's Sun mission For the first time Aditya-L1 will be able to watch the Sun in its maximum activity cycle. Forgotten photos reveal women who powered India's freedom struggle Newly found photos highlight women’s key role in Mahatma Gandhi’s civil disobedience movement against British rule. Reform or rights rollback? Sweeping labour law overhaul sparks debate Companies have given the changes a thumbs-up but trade unions say the laws  further weaken worker rights. 'I panic every time she coughs' - Delhi's toxic air is making its children sick Hospitals have seen an influx of children sneezing, coughing or complaining of breathing difficulties. Invincible no more: Why India's Test cricket reputation lies in ruins India's shocking series defeat to South Africa has left fans anguished and Indian cricket beleaguered. Watch 'Felt embarrassed to be called good looking': Dharmendra The veteran Indian actor, often called a 'Greek God', has died. Watch this excerpt from his 2018 interview. Verified videos show aftermath of explosion in Delhi Police say eight people have been killed after a car explodes near Delhi's Red Fort landmark in India. Fans celebrate women's World Cup win India's women's cricket team beat South Africa by 52 runs in the final on Sunday night. Trump imitates India's PM Narendra Modi in South Korea Trump impersonated Modi while recalling his conversations from the May India-Pakistan conflict Woman saved after slipping while boarding a moving train Video released by India’s Southern Railways shows the moment a woman nearly fell in between a moving train and a station platform. Latest updates 6 hrs ago More than 300 flights cancelled as Indian airline faces 'staff shortage' Indigo said the disruptions were caused by technical glitches and the impact of updated crew roster rules. 6 hrs ago 7 hrs ago Indian scientists spot Milky Way-like galaxy from 12 billion years ago The galaxy's discovery challenges our understanding of how galaxies were formed in the early period after the Big Bang. 7 hrs ago 13 hrs ago Oil, defence and geopolitics: Why Putin is visiting Modi in Delhi BBC editors explain what is at stake as Russian President Vladimir Putin starts a two-day visit to India. 13 hrs ago 19 hrs ago South Africa chase record 359 to beat India South Africa complete the joint highest chase in the history of one-day internationals in India as they passed a target of 359 to win by four wickets in Naya Raipur. 19 hrs ago 1 day ago India scraps order to pre-install state-run cyber safety app on smartphones The order to make the registration mandatory had led to a major backlash from several cyber experts. 1 day ago 1 day ago Delhi records 200,000 acute respiratory illness cases amid toxic air More than 30,000 people with respiratory illnesses had to be hospitalised in Delhi between 2022 and 2024. 1 day ago 1 day ago Family of murdered man want body returned to India Vijay Kumar's family say they are "trying to cope with this harsh reality" following his death. 1 day ago 2 days ago India tells smartphone makers to put state-run cyber safety app on new devices India wants all smartphone makers to pre-install new devices with a state-owned cyber security app. 2 days ago 3 days ago India's Supreme Court upholds rights of poorest - but language reveals 'bias', study says Research into judgements from 1950 to 2025 suggests India's top court often reinforces caste hierarchies in language, even while upholding Dalit rights. 3 days ago ...
